2198879c-d559-4008-9558-c67479972b66.description: Earners of this badge from the VCU da Vinci Center's Introduction to Design Thinking have been introduced to the six foundational steps in the design thinking process: defining How Might We challenges, seeking extremes, creating options, selecting ideas, prototyping, and feedback. Participants engaged in individual and collaborative exercises that allowed them to practice each of the six steps and resulted in the creation of a low-fidelity prototype and digital asset that demonstrated mastery.
2198879c-d559-4008-9558-c67479972b66.name: Introduction to Design Thinking

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in 6 modules explaining the Design Thinking Process.

7be1707e-718e-432b-baa5-417465d3a876.description: Earners of this badge have developed the entry-level skills needed to identify steps and begin the process of developing an antiracist mindset. They can analyze contributing factors, which lead to the formulation of bias and model practices to minimize implicit bias, institutional bias and systemic racism. Earners can apply a critically reflective lens to analyze personal antiracist behaviors and identify opportunities to sustain antiracist actions in education.
7be1707e-718e-432b-baa5-417465d3a876.name: Antiracist Educator Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the 9 session virtual series consisting of 13.5 to 18 contact hours. Courses are 1.5 to 2 hours each and include Antiracism 101, Developing an Antiracist Mindset, Deconstructing Implicit Bias, Deepening our Understanding of Systemic Racism, Determining the Impact of Power and Privilege, Dismantling Racial Disproportionality, Designing Antiracist Student Supports, Developing Sustainable Antiracist Environments, and Doing the Work: Allies, Accomplices, and Co-conspirators.

7e43c626-781a-4220-bd71-94a963857f01.description: Earners of this badge successfully completed Foundations in Mentoring for Clinical Faculty at the Center for Teacher Leadership within the VCU School of Education. They are proficient in creating professional growth environments for preservice, novice, and veteran teachers grounded in the norms of inquiry, ongoing assessment, and problem solving. They are able to demonstrate the attitudes, behaviors, and skills of effective coaching and use various tools of formative assessment and support.
7e43c626-781a-4220-bd71-94a963857f01.name: Clinical Faculty

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an application process that includes a principal endorsement.
Attend all Clinical Faculty modules and practice using the formative assessment tools and language with a preservice, novice, or veteran teacher.

Complete an assessment process demonstrating proficiency using the formative assessment tools and language, which includes a video of the post-observation conference and responses to reflective questions.

67089abb-e613-4b08-95fd-a38fdccf2828.description: Earners are VCU undergraduate researchers who presented their mentored research at a campus or professional research conference or symposium. They are able to communicate their research and scholarship to diverse audiences to include their peers, members of the public, and those engaged in their academic discipline(s). They are able to utilize and articulate the language of their discipline(s) while conveying complex concepts in accessible ways.
67089abb-e613-4b08-95fd-a38fdccf2828.name: Presentation of Research

badge_template_activities.title: Conduct undergraduate research under the guidance and supervision of a research mentor documented by the VCU Office of Undergraduate Research and Creative Inquiry.
Apply for and gain acceptance to a campus or professional research conference or symposium.
Present research/scholarship at a campus or professional conference or symposium. Presentations are either oral , lecture, panel or poster presentations.

c3a1fa9f-e436-4bcf-840f-bbcd4bd7e85e.description: Earners completed a customized learning experience embracing the fullness of womanhood in all its inclusive paths and intersectional journeys and have learned how womanhood shapes their leadership journeys at home, work, and in communities. They engage with Institute leaders, regional and national experts, and a network of peers for a one-day, multi-track experience offering a self-directed facilitated learning environment with education sessions and interactive forums.
c3a1fa9f-e436-4bcf-840f-bbcd4bd7e85e.name: HIGHER Ground Women's Leadership Conference

badge_template_activities.title: Participants explore the latest and innovative practices in leadership excellence at the one day conference.

c0f06d39-8ec7-46df-b7fe-4dbca303ee7f.description: Earners of this badge are aware of our institutional past, including our perceived and actual history as these have been impacted by systemic racism. They have an understanding of how VCU’s organizational culture, climate and identity came to be. Understanding our history allows us to better understand how we have affected and been affected by our surrounding communities. Activities also included learning about healthcare’s role, and specifically VCU Health’s role, in promoting social justice.
c0f06d39-8ec7-46df-b7fe-4dbca303ee7f.name: History and Health: Racial Equity

badge_template_activities.title: Attend at least four sessions and one Let’s Talk reflection opportunity. The History and Health series includes events and learning modules. Topics cover the history of the Medical Campus of Virginia and its intersections of health equity, health disparities, systemic racism, and social justice. Completion time is 4-5 hours.

4b61bc3f-8212-40e2-aec4-b6c216c287f1.description: Earners of this designation have the foundational skills needed to use the therapeutic power of play with clients using play-based interventions. They can discuss the rationale, history, and theoretical models of play therapy. Earners can explain the rationale for using non-directive versus directive approaches and prescriptive versus integrated approaches. Earners can set and enforce limits, communicate with parents, select therapeutic toys, and terminate client play therapy appropriately.
4b61bc3f-8212-40e2-aec4-b6c216c287f1.name: Play Therapy: Principles

badge_template_activities.title: Possess an active, unconditional state mental health license or currently employed (and/or pursuing education) in a behavioral health or school counseling field.
Complete the 16 contact hour workshop of play therapy training through VCU Continuing and Professional Education (APT Approved Provider 15-397).
Pass a two-part assessment including a multiple-choice test and scored rubric demonstrating mastery of workshop objectives via small and large group activities and discussion.

66335625-ac5b-412c-94b6-8fc6b67ad093.description: Earners have the skills necessary to interrupt racism and put them into practice to sustain antiracism work. They understand the intersections between racism and other systemic oppression and can identify programs that function as racist mechanisms. They can develop action plans for classrooms and communities to disrupt racist mechanisms and recommend new ways to develop curriculum rooted in antiracist ideas. They exemplify culturally sustainable antiracist classroom practices and perspectives.
66335625-ac5b-412c-94b6-8fc6b67ad093.name: Antiracist Educator Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 9 virtual sessions (1.5-2 hours each) including Antiracism in Practice, Addressing Racial Equity Approaches in Educ w/Antiracism, Advancing Understanding of Your Own Implicit Biases, Unpacking Systemic Racism & the Legacy of Educ, Critical Interrogation of Privilege & Whiteness, Understanding Disproportionality in School Culture, Applying Antiracist Practices in the Classroom, Challenging Racist Mechanisms through Advocacy & Action, Cultivating Practices for Co-Conspirators.

955c25a6-cc1e-4c9d-aa1c-5c64eaa0fba4.description: Earners have learned the basics of crafting and delivering a pitch. They have the ability to effectively communicate who they are, what they do, and what they are asking from their audience. Earners understand background information on the philosophy and mechanics behind different pitch types and their applications.
955c25a6-cc1e-4c9d-aa1c-5c64eaa0fba4.name: The Art of the Pitch

badge_template_activities.title: After viewing the approximately 1 hour module, complete the Entrepreneurship Academy Art of the Pitch module assessment/quiz.
Complete the 60 second pitch at the conclusion of the module.

60ed66bf-7b7d-46c8-9c08-0f6bbf45c743.description: Earners of this credential have demonstrated fundamental knowledge, skills, and abilities in data analysis, data visualization, and data security. Earners have completed curriculum that aligns with the employer-validated, digital tech competencies required for jobs with Capital CoLAB employers.
60ed66bf-7b7d-46c8-9c08-0f6bbf45c743.name: Generalist Digital Technology Credential

badge_template_activities.title: CMSC 210 Computers and Programming
CMSC 330 Data Science Skills  Prerequisite: CMSC 210 Introduction to Data Science Skills
CMSC 340 Cybersecurity Skills  Prerequisite: CMSC 210 Introduction to Cybersecurity Skills

6cee4b8b-0465-4f39-8943-b3c61eec23b3.description: Earners of this badge are distinguished by their ability to understand the data as well as the data requirements for business decision-making. They possess intermediate-level spreadsheet skills and are familiar with data functions and tools available in Microsoft Excel 365. They can create custom reports as required for business decision-making.
6cee4b8b-0465-4f39-8943-b3c61eec23b3.name: Level I Data Specialist: Microsoft Excel 365

badge_template_activities.title: Complete seven week curriculum, including solving seven weekly mini cases.
Solve master business case at the end of the course.

a9b18f2d-4288-44ab-bdaf-e9c4b1b91161.description: Earners of the Health Sciences Academy's Health Career Exploration Certificate have developed the skills necessary to make informed decisions about health career options and in-demand college majors they can pursue. They are competent in assessing their interests, values, and skills and applying what they learned about themselves in order to make critical educational and career decisions.
a9b18f2d-4288-44ab-bdaf-e9c4b1b91161.name: Health Career Exploration Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 5 reflective writing essays, take and process self-directed search career inventory, present a plan of curricular and extracurricular activities to achieve career goals, plan and complete 20 hours of service in a health care setting, and attend a 15 week program of health career exploration lectures, structured mentoring, and active learning lab activities.

c3eba35d-1de2-469a-8b09-5323511523b0.description: Earners of this badge completed the SHRM© preparation course in order to successfully sit for the SHRM-CP or SHRM-SCP certifying exam. They know the SHRM Body of Knowledge, and have demonstrated their human resources competency.
c3eba35d-1de2-469a-8b09-5323511523b0.name: Human Resources Management Certification Prep Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the live, 14-week training course on SHRM BoCK™.
Complete required final examination.

e83db829-6ada-4ae7-8e2c-ed332245e529.description: Earners of this badge successfully completed a renewal process and participation for at least five years in the Clinical Faculty Program. They continue to demonstrate proficiency in creating professional growth environments for preservice, novice, and veteran teachers grounded in the norms of inquiry, ongoing assessment, and problem solving. They continue to demonstrate the attitudes, behaviors, and skills of effective coaching and use various tools of formative assessment and support.
e83db829-6ada-4ae7-8e2c-ed332245e529.name: Clinical Faculty 5-Year Renewal

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an assessment process demonstrating proficiency using the formative assessment tools and language, which includes a video of the post-observation conference and responses to reflective questions.

748c9a15-ea3a-4685-878e-c7a056dd8d0c.description: Earners can apply knowledge of the lifecycle of a sponsored project to the grants management portfolio(s) of their unit(s). This includes mastering key concepts and compliance requirements related to the management of sponsored projects from pre-award and post-award perspectives. They have the knowledge to apply related processes, procedures, and regulations at various points in project management from the development and submission of a funding proposal to close out and audit of a project.
748c9a15-ea3a-4685-878e-c7a056dd8d0c.name: Fundamentals of Research Administration

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of the Fundamentals of Research Administration e-learning course.

aa3f203a-e2a5-4707-9aa8-cb6793b8a86c.description: Earners have turned ideas into action through the completion of a Business Model Canvas, an organizational tool used by global business leaders to develop insights and engage in strategic planning. Earners know how to break down the fundamentals of the Business Model Canvas and apply their newly acquired knowledge in the development of their own Canvas for feedback from a trained facilitator.
aa3f203a-e2a5-4707-9aa8-cb6793b8a86c.name: Introduction to Business Model Canvas

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the business model canvas template and the module assessment/quiz.
Complete and submit a business model canvas.

08829841-4829-4c3d-ae1c-4815b1212471.description: Earners of this badge have acquired the skills needed to be a paralegal. They are proficient in legal-specific skills such as maintaining and organizing files and documents, drafting briefs and complaints for review, investigating fact patterns, conducting law-related research and preparing cases for courtroom litigation.
08829841-4829-4c3d-ae1c-4815b1212471.name: Certificate in Paralegal Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Complete six noncredit course modules including Introduction to Law, Torts and Personal Injury, Civil Litigation, Legal Research and Writing, Business Law, and Contract Law. (120 Contact Hours)
Achieve a minimum of 70% or higher in each course module and an overall average of 75% or higher in the full certificate program.

10dc52f0-111b-4bde-81c2-41917bd3441d.description: Earners have an understanding of the building blocks of innovation. Included are the fundamentals of brainstorming and rapid ideation, what makes a good idea, the recipe for a successful brainstorming session, and how to select a new idea to test.
10dc52f0-111b-4bde-81c2-41917bd3441d.name: Introduction to Ideation

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete video course modules including pre-learning assessments, quizzes, and documentation of ideation process.

a5101a7a-1fd2-4d2f-9baf-f1aacf825c03.description: Earners of this badge are leaders who are able to build an empowering, fair, open and supportive environment in their workplace. They can cultivate a culture of inclusion and effectively manage individuals’ perceptual and psychological processes about difference and diversity. Earners are able to facilitate meaningful and productive interactions, especially in collaborative and team environments both within and outside the academic environment.
a5101a7a-1fd2-4d2f-9baf-f1aacf825c03.name: IExcel Diversity and Inclusion Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Apply to be accepted to participate in the Diversity and Inclusion Leadership Certificate program.

Complete the noncredit certificate program consisting of 40 hours of course work. Courses are eight contact hours each and include four required courses and one specialty course. Required courses are: Fundamentals of Diversity and Inclusion; Implicit Bias and Microaggressions; Leading Diverse Teams; and Building an Inclusive Community. The specialty course consists of either Cultivating Inclusive Learning Environments; D&I in Healthcare; or Advancing Diversity and Equity in Corporate Settings.
Complete a final capstone project for each course.

86779141-e1e3-40f4-8add-df18ab45a753.description: Earners of this badge have a fundamental knowledge of good project management practices. They know the steps needed to initiate and plan for project management success. Earners are able to develop a stakeholder management plan, develop the six components of a scope statement, and create a project scope statement.
86779141-e1e3-40f4-8add-df18ab45a753.name: Project Management Essentials Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Complete live, in class training as well as independent work.
Complete all in class projects demonstrating knowledge of Project Management principles.
Pass final examination.

6461b9b5-b583-45d0-900b-6a14cff228f4.description: Earners of this badge have proficiency in the creation of digital deliverables using select Adobe Creative Cloud software. Participants have demonstrated an ability to use digital tools along with experiences in creativity, critical thinking, creative problem solving, and collaboration. Collectively, these 21st Century skills provide a foundation for digital literacy and communication.
6461b9b5-b583-45d0-900b-6a14cff228f4.name: Introduction to Digital Literacy

badge_template_activities.title: Submit file formatted deliverables in both Adobe InDesign and Premiere/Pro, and optionally submit files in Illustrator, Spark, XD, and Photoshop.
Submit evidence of startup progress through the design of executive summary and presentation materials, and optionally submit a logo, website template, and edited photos.

489e2e24-bea7-425a-8836-943958860548.description: Earners have the skills to uncover their leadership styles and improve skills, behaviors, competencies, and practices through personal development and feedback. They can collaborate in an ever-changing society by creating and managing high-performance work teams in their organizations; communicate and manage conflicts among diverse groups; and connect in order to motivate and inspire desired outcomes and influence positive well-being.
489e2e24-bea7-425a-8836-943958860548.name: HIGHER Ground Women's Leadership Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Candidates submit a completed application along with a resume, personal statement, bio-sketch, and 1 nomination form.

Participants complete lectures, workshops, and experiential learning through practice-in-action and reflective inquiry. Focusing on self-discovery, they complete a series of intensive leadership assessments, personality style inventories, and a comprehensive 360-degree feedback survey. In addition to in-class hours, 4 to 5 hours per month are spent outside of scheduled program sessions to support their learning and development.

Participants complete a leadership portfolio of documents, objects, works, and artifacts that constitute a tangible record of their reflection of learning, personal and professional development, accomplishments, and experiences during the program. The portfolio is a comprehensive catalog of their leadership development plan, assessment tools, conceptual models, and other resources, which foster self-awareness and reflection and the creation of personal and professional development strategies.

a43f0be9-83cf-4a5c-82fc-ccfc8e442c5a.description: Earners have an understanding of the building blocks of change management including the fundamental skills necessary for change management within organizations. They know the frameworks necessary for anyone involved in managing change and have experienced hands-on practice using change management techniques within a low-risk environment.
a43f0be9-83cf-4a5c-82fc-ccfc8e442c5a.name: Introduction to Change Management

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the interactive simulation training, quizzes, and attend the entire course in order to successfully complete the modules.

f18d2f86-1688-4688-8801-7d1b45fc5ddb.description: Earners have successfully completed the Center for Corporate Education ELP residential week in partnership with Owens and Minor. Through learning and practice, they have an increased understanding of the soft and technical skills needed to develop into an effective leader.
f18d2f86-1688-4688-8801-7d1b45fc5ddb.name: Owens and Minor Emerging Leaders Program

badge_template_activities.title: Over the course of a week, participate in live, in class training, as well as team and independent work. Learning modules include topics on self-awareness, DEI initiatives, communication and presence, developing others, developing a growth mindset, business and financial acumen, decision making, critical thinking, change management, and strategy.
Working with a team, develop a presentation in response to a leadership prompt and demonstrate communication and executive presence skills in front of an audience.

10ac4409-7520-4400-8f38-7dd644b7d4b1.description: Earners of this designation have the demonstrated skills to discuss traumatic and grief reactions in children and ways to support caregivers during treatment. They can articulate how trauma impacts children and how play therapy allows children to use the language of play to resolve these issues and return to tasks needed for healthy development. Earners can discuss and apply major protocols and phases of treatment and implement interventions for different age groups and developmental levels.
10ac4409-7520-4400-8f38-7dd644b7d4b1.name: Play Therapy: Healing Trauma and Loss

badge_template_activities.title: Possess an active, unconditional state mental health license or currently employed (and/or pursuing education) in a behavioral health or school counseling field.
Complete the 16 contact hour workshop of play therapy training through VCU Continuing and Professional Education (APT Approved Provider 15-397).
Pass a two-part assessment including a multiple-choice test and scored rubric demonstrating mastery of workshop objectives via small and large group activities and discussion.

9c502246-e4f4-4470-908c-20ec7364b4ee.description: Earners of this IExcel badge have a fundamental understanding of how diversity drives excellence. Leaders can identify forces that impede inclusion and engagement in the workplace, identify diversity and inclusion gaps in self and organization, and learn tools and skills that are key to inclusive leadership.
9c502246-e4f4-4470-908c-20ec7364b4ee.name: Executive Leadership Diversity and Inclusion Training

badge_template_activities.title: Participants engage in a shared learning experience that elevates their critical consciousness as leaders through an interactive half-day session of learning, discussion, and activities. Leaders create a plan to develop key leadership skills required to nurture an inclusive community in the workplace.

e43a365c-1d12-4479-a65c-2524bec117cd.description: Earners of this badge have developed the entry-level skills needed to identify steps and begin the process of developing an antiracist mindset. They can analyze contributing factors, which lead to the formulation of bias and model practices to minimize implicit bias, institutional bias and systemic racism. Earners can apply a critically reflective lens to analyze personal antiracist behaviors and identify opportunities to sustain antiracist actions in their organizations.
e43a365c-1d12-4479-a65c-2524bec117cd.name: Antiracist Leader Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the 9 session virtual series consisting of 18 contact hours. Courses are 2 hours each and include Antiracism 101, Developing an Antiracist Mindset, Deconstructing Implicit Bias, Deepening our Understanding of Systemic Racism, Determining the Impact of Power and Privilege, Dismantling Racial Disproportionality, Designing Antiracist Supports for Colleagues, Developing Sustainable Antiracist Environments, and Doing the Work: Allies, Accomplices, and Co-conspirators.

149e7f15-7811-43e1-96dc-249dc35dbce3.description: Earners of this IExcel badge have a fundamental understanding of diversity and inclusion and how that impacts inclusive dialogue. Learners gained communication and facilitation skills and can lead inclusive dialogue centering lived experiences and social identities.
149e7f15-7811-43e1-96dc-249dc35dbce3.name: Diversity and Inclusion Facilitator Training

badge_template_activities.title: Apply to be accepted to participate in Diversity and Inclusion Facilitator Training.

Participants attend 16+ hours Diversity and Inclusion facilitator training over multiple days. Training sessions are centered around inclusive dialogue and cover topics such as: identity, deep listening, rapport-building, navigating tension and conflict, among other core facilitation skills.

3ec301e9-9001-41f5-a70d-f94fbd1a0158.description: Earners of this badge have an understanding of the DMAIC (Define, Measure, Analyze, and Control) methodology. They know how to measure and improve an organization's operational performance, practices and systems making an impact throughout.
3ec301e9-9001-41f5-a70d-f94fbd1a0158.name: Lean Six Sigma: Green Belt Training

badge_template_activities.title: Complete live, in class training as well as independent work.
Complete all in class projects demonstrating knowledge of Lean Six Sigma principles.

1ffa8dc4-b9ac-465f-a9e4-71f59c1a59ee.description: Earners understand the key stakeholder's role in promoting a diverse PK12 teacher workforce & can identify local, state & federal level sources to invest in recruiting/retaining teachers of color. They can develop partnerships to build teacher residency programs; infuse culturally responsive & sustaining practices in these partnerships; identify culturally responsive & sustaining mentoring & induction interventions & strategies to develop, support & sustain affinity groups for teachers of color.
1ffa8dc4-b9ac-465f-a9e4-71f59c1a59ee.name: Strategies to Promote a Culturally Diverse PK-12 Teaching Workforce

badge_template_activities.title: Attend the 5 session virtual series consisting of 8.75 contact hours. Courses are 1.75 each and include Role of Schools, Districts, IHEs, and Policymakers in Diversifying the Teacher Workforce, Community and School Partnerships (Attracting Teachers of Color), Understanding and Establishing Grow Your Own Programs (Teacher Residency Programs), Deconstructing Culturally Responsive Mentoring and Induction Supports, Beginning Affinity Groups for Teachers of Color.

d3c74e11-5ab9-4416-b11f-6a2d1e54bd1b.description: Earners of this designation have demonstrated skills to use therapeutic and traditional games/activities in a play therapy setting. They can articulate when to choose a directive play-based activity based upon clients’ developmental state, clinical issue and specific therapeutic goals and set limits. Earners are able to organize a playroom with play therapy activities that decrease stress, strengthen coping skills, increase emotional regulation, and improve self-esteem.
d3c74e11-5ab9-4416-b11f-6a2d1e54bd1b.name: Play Therapy: Games and Activities

badge_template_activities.title: Possess an active, unconditional state mental health license or currently employed (and/or pursuing education) in a behavioral health or school counseling field.
Complete the 16 contact hour workshop of play therapy training through VCU Continuing and Professional Education (APT Approved Provider 15-397).
Pass a two-part assessment including a multiple-choice test and scored rubric demonstrating mastery of workshop objectives via small and large group activities and discussion.

cb4c6b05-74a3-481a-bd65-366164ad21ff.description: Earners understand principles of transformational leadership & can clarify their plans for ongoing influence; have a deeper understanding of VCU's structure, mission & vision; and build a sense of community with colleagues to strengthen their network. They have enhanced self-knowledge & tools to motivate leadership in others in fulfilling VCU's mission with the expectation they serve as a positive impact for change in higher ed, locally, statewide and nationally drawing on strengths.
cb4c6b05-74a3-481a-bd65-366164ad21ff.name: VCU Leadership Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants submit a completed online application form, current position description, personal statement, curriculum vitae, bio sketch, one nomination from a dean or vice president, and two recommendations from supervisors and/or colleagues.

At the program's start, participants complete a series of intensive leadership assessments, including personality style inventories and 360º Feedback. Throughout the program, participants examine the ways in which their individual styles and behaviors impacts their colleagues and workplace environment. A significant portion of the interactive sessions and readings deal with professional leadership skill development.

Participants work in teams to address issues of current importance to the University. Together with a team sponsor from upper administration, these interdisciplinary teams carry out a project during the course of the program. The interdisciplinary nature of the teams provides excellent opportunities for learning new perspectives and networking across campuses. Project teams also provide a venue for applying new skills and developing creative strategies for solving problems

1c5a0d63-a1ea-4ccc-98ca-5a9696d21a96.description: Earners of this designation can demonstrate how to use sand tray in different modalities including: sensory, directive and non-directive. They can demonstrate creative narrative techniques and analyze themes that emerge. Earners can discuss the rationale for miniature selection and practice interventions for using sand tray in play sessions with children and adolescents. They can articulate the history and key theories that contributed to sand tray use in current play therapy.
1c5a0d63-a1ea-4ccc-98ca-5a9696d21a96.name: Play Therapy: Sand Tray and Narrative Techniques

badge_template_activities.title: Possess an active, unconditional state mental health license or currently employed (and/or pursuing education) in a behavioral health or school counseling field.
Complete the 16 contact hour workshop of play therapy training through VCU Continuing and Professional Education (APT Approved Provider 15-397).
Pass a two-part assessment including a multiple-choice test and scored rubric demonstrating mastery of workshop objectives via small and large group activities and discussion.

dfb30d01-e19a-492f-8051-68d2e00b700e.description: Earners of this designation have the skills to utilize expressive modalities such as art, music, drama, storytelling, movement and poetry with tweens, teens and other populations. Earners are able to identify archetypes, symbols and metaphors in expressive and play therapy work. They are able to explain and apply Gestalt theory in a play therapy setting. Earners can compile materials for a variety of populations, ages and developmental stages for client in-depth self expression in a safe space.
dfb30d01-e19a-492f-8051-68d2e00b700e.name: Play Therapy: Expressive Arts

badge_template_activities.title: Possess an active, unconditional state mental health license or currently employed (and/or pursuing education) in a behavioral health field or school counseling field.
Complete the 16 contact hour workshop of play therapy training through VCU Continuing and Professional Education (APT Approved Provider 15-397).
Pass a two-part assessment including a multiple-choice test and scored rubric demonstrating mastery of workshop objectives via small and large group activities and discussion.

9e7bd11b-3977-4f59-b103-7c1133491511.description: Earners of this badge have a better understanding of how to harness the power of culture in their organizations and assess its alignment with strategy. They understand their team's dynamic in order to manifest a creative, productive environment, and they know how to use blended management tools designed to accelerate cultural and strategic team development. Earners are familiar with new approaches to managing companies and markets blending narrative economics, philosophy, and communication.
9e7bd11b-3977-4f59-b103-7c1133491511.name: BCX: Strategic & Cultural Leadership Series

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Strategic & Cultural Leadership Series program through BCX, the Brandcenter's Executive Education Division.

dd068ffa-5f36-4d65-984b-a810934f573a.description: Earners have complemented their formal graduate business education with additional exploration of leadership considerations around caring and compassionate leadership, sustainability, people development, strategic planning and social responsibility. They have learned to be powerful change agents to transform business education by developing leaders who honor individual dignity, demonstrate the courage to care for others, and work toward shared wellbeing on a healthy planet.
dd068ffa-5f36-4d65-984b-a810934f573a.name: Humanistic Leadership

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Humanistic Leadership Academy which is a 6-session (12 hours total) interactive course for MBAs that includes lectures, Q&As and practice/simulation.
Complete a final team project.

25c2b91b-2eeb-4fac-b937-75b8656f0c85.description: Earners of this badge have the skills needed to safely operate basic hand and power tools and bench mounted power equipment. They can utilize equipment including a floor mounted drill press, horizontal and vertical industrial bandsaws, tap and dies, and belt sanders, and they can set up and operate a manual mill and lathe. They are proficient in safety procedures and are able to serve as a leader to their peers by providing appropriate guidance and education in their shared makerspace.

Complete assigned projects for each module.

b367cfa1-a6e8-4dff-9dca-165069e616ed.description: Earners of this badge successfully completed a renewal process and participation for at least ten years in the Clinical Faculty Program. They continue to demonstrate proficiency in creating professional growth environments for preservice, novice, and veteran teachers grounded in the norms of inquiry, ongoing assessment, and problem solving. They continue to demonstrate the attitudes, behaviors, and skills of effective coaching and use various tools of formative assessment and support.
b367cfa1-a6e8-4dff-9dca-165069e616ed.name: Clinical Faculty 10-Year Renewal

badge_template_activities.title: Complete an assessment process demonstrating proficiency using the formative assessment tools and language, which includes a video of the post-observation conference and responses to reflective questions.

c46a6ebc-f5fa-48bc-8501-73c95354339d.description: Earners of this badge have fundamental knowledge of the theory and practice of scientific method to address health equity and health disparities. They have increased understanding of scientific writing and presentation, and how to apply to their own CV, professional statements, and research statements. Earners are able to facilitate meaningful and productive research, especially in collaborative teams within academic and community environments.
c46a6ebc-f5fa-48bc-8501-73c95354339d.name: iCubed Commonwealth Scholars Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participants must apply to the program, have a 3.5 GPA for entry, full-time student status at the university, and full time status in the iCubed program for one (1) year.
Participate and fully engage for one year of 5-10 hours of research mentorship per week. Must meet with mentors on a monthly basis.
Students must successfully complete an Abstract submission, Poster presentation, Professional documents (CV, accompanying statements), and CITI training.

1bd4504c-c535-43f6-9135-061eb1b60fda.description: Earners understand the principles of social equity & transformational leadership & can clarify their plans for ongoing policy influence & advocacy. The program promotes leadership in policy areas important to minority communities against the backdrop of Virginia's political landscape. Earners have a better understanding of the impact of public policy throughout the Commonwealth & have leadership skills in equity analysis, consensus building, cross-cultural competencies & transformational change.
1bd4504c-c535-43f6-9135-061eb1b60fda.name: Minority Political Leadership Institute (MPLI)

badge_template_activities.title: Candidates submit a completed online application form, personal statement, resume, bio sketch, and two references from colleagues who can attest to the applicant's leadership potential, abilities, and current responsibilities.

Throughout the program, participants travel to five major regions in the state to learn about racial equity and garner first-hand accounts from community members and leaders about policy issues and trends in the geographical and cultural context. Alongside this, they examine how their individual styles and behaviors influence their leadership presence through several intensive assessments. Finally, participants further advance their voice through a written Op-Ed or Letter to the Editor.

Racial Equity Analysis of Legislation. Participants work on project teams to examine how proposed or passed legislation from the General Assembly may enhance racial disparities, reduce racial disparities, and/or have racial/ethnic impact.

alignments.description: The American Association of Nurse Anesthesiology (AANA) has pre-approved each Socratic Seminar (facilitated leadership book discussion) for three Class A Continuing Education (CE) credits. The AANA is the recognized approver of Class A CE credit by the National Board of Certification and Recertification for Nurse Anesthetists (NBCRNA).

badge_template_activities.title: Participants read five (5) pre-approved curated leadership books and then participate in five (5) three-hour facilitated discussions with other health professionals for a total of 15 hours. The American Association of Nurse Anesthesiology (AANA) has pre-approved each Socratic Seminar leadership book selection for three (3) Class A CE Credits each.
Complete a learner assessment and program evaluation for each book.

42cfad6a-383f-4745-a88b-e094b2bd465a.description: Earners of this badge have the skills necessary for effective delegation, performance management, and writing performance reviews. They understand the specifics of the supervisor's role and responsibilities, and strategies for improving their overall effectiveness as a leader.
42cfad6a-383f-4745-a88b-e094b2bd465a.name: Supervisory and Leadership Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: The certificate requires completion of four units: Understanding the Role of the Supervisor, Effective Delegation, Performance Management, and Writing Performance Reviews.
Achieve a passing score of 80% or better on all self-quizzes for each unit.
Complete written online discussions with the instructor and other participants at least once a week.
